images.heading: Fitness Professional Branding + Design
images.subheading: Branding & UI/UX for a fitness professional. Mike wanted to stick to the colors Turquoise, Orange, and Black. I used those as highlights and kept the background white to maintain an overall fresh and clean aesthetic. Aside from the design I built out the UI/UX of the website, featuring an easy-to-read layout and collapsible menus with an emphasis on grabbing a users attention with large, bright CTA's.

images.heading: UX for Referral Program
images.subheading: Headnote, a payment processing platform for attorneys needed to build out the UI/UX elements for a referral program they were launching. A circular button marked with a ’$’ was added in the navbar to represent the referral program incentives. Once clicked, the user is led to a page featuring a simple, clear, and easy to navigate user experience. The second image showcases the confirmation message once the referrals are sent. The design also featured a system of tracking referrals and credits earned from the program. Tools used: Adobe Illustrator, Sketch.

images.heading: Vending Machine
images.subheading: This was one of my favorite projects. The client wanted a clean, crisp, fresh look. The main requests for the aesthetic was the specific shade of green for the background and a handwritten font style. I decided to feature two different varieties of the products on each side of the machine and highlight the main ingredients.

images.heading: Food Package Design (Spout Pouch)
images.subheading: I focused on a color palette consisting of three main colors: yellow, white, and grey. In the limited space I had with this design (4.3in x 2.75in), the product design and copy is focused on educating consumers about how to use the product, its ingredients, and their origin in an easy to read format.

images.heading: Food Package Design (Spout Pouch)
images.subheading: I focused on a color palette consisting of three main colors: orange, white, and grey. In the limited space I had with this design (4.3in x 2.75in), the product design and copy is focused on educating consumers about how to use the product, its ingredients, and their origin in an easy to read format.

images.heading: Banner Ad Designs (Corporate)
images.subheading: Brass Animals is a service that connects people from all over the nation to a local brass band for their events. This ad series was designed to cater towards a corporate audience. I decided to focus on a holiday theme given the upcoming season. All ads are scaled to dimensions for the following ad types: Leaderboard (top), Skyscraper (left), Half Page (middle), In-line rectangle (right).

images.heading: Banner Ad Designs (Wedding Clients)
images.subheading: Brass Animals is a service that connects people from all over the nation to a local brass band for their events. This ad series was designed to cater towards wedding clientele. All ads are scaled to dimensions for the following ad types: Leaderboard (top), Skyscraper (left), Half Page (middle), In-line rectangle (right)

images.heading: Banner Ad Designs (Creative Versions)
images.subheading: This is an experimental ad series for the corporate audience. It acts as a variant in our A/B test to see if a ‘funner’ ad would perform better versus the standard one. All ads are scaled to dimensions for the following ad types: Leaderboard (top), Skyscraper (left), Half Page (middle), In-line rectangle (right)

images.heading: Ad + Email Header Designs
images.subheading: Plum Lending is a CRE lending firm, they were looking for a new set of banner ads along with a customized email header image. I switched over to their white logo and added pops of purple to represent the brand color.

images.heading: Email Header Designs
images.subheading: Headnote, a payment processing platform for attorneys needed to add some vibrance to their visually bland, text-only email templates. Here are a few of the concepts for their various email marketing funnels.
